speaker: Elena
text: If you forget to set up environment variables correctly, the whole deployment fails.
ipa: ɪf ju fɚˈɡɛt tu sɛt ʌp ɪnˈvaɪɚənmənt ˈvɛɹiəbəlz kəˈɹɛktli | ðə hoʊl dɪˈplɔɪmənt feɪlz
stress: IF you FORGET to SET UP ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES CORRECTLY | the WHOLE DEPLOYMENT FAILS
linking:
"set up environment" → /sɛt ʌp ɪnˈvaɪɚənmənt/ (p + i linking)
"deployment fails" → /dɪˈplɔɪmənt feɪlz/ (t + f linking)

speaker: Marco
text: Yup. And if Jenkins doesn’t detect the branch properly, it won’t trigger the pipeline at all.
ipa: jʌp | ænd ɪf ˈʤɛnkɪnz ˈdʌzənt dɪˈtɛkt ðə bɹæntʃ ˈpɹɑpɚli | ɪt woʊnt ˈtɹɪɡɚ ðə ˈpaɪplaɪn æt ɔl
stress: YUP | AND IF JENKINS DOESN’T DETECT the BRANCH PROPERLY | it WON’T TRIGGER the PIPELINE at ALL
linking:
"Jenkins doesn’t" → /ˈʤɛnkɪnz ˈdʌzənt/ (s + d linking)
"trigger the" → /ˈtɹɪɡɚ ðə/ (r + th linking)

speaker: Elena
text: Exactly. That’s why I always double-check. If you change the YAML file syntax even slightly, the system throws an error.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ðæts waɪ aɪ ˈɔlweɪz ˈdʌbəl tʃɛk | ɪf ju tʃeɪndʒ ðə ˈjæməl faɪl ˈsɪntæks ˈivən ˈslaɪtli | ðə ˈsɪstəm θɹoʊz ən ˈɛɹɚ
stress: EXACTLY | THAT’S WHY I ALWAYS DOUBLE-CHECK | IF YOU CHANGE the YAML FILE SYNTAX EVEN SLIGHTLY | the SYSTEM THROWS an ERROR
linking:
"double-check. If" → /ˈdʌbəl tʃɛk ɪf/ (k + i linking)
"throws an" → /θɹoʊz ən/ (z + a linking)

speaker: Marco
text: It’s the same with Ansible. If one host isn't reachable, the playbook stops running completely.
ipa: ɪts ðə seɪm wɪð ˈænsəbəl | ɪf wʌn hoʊst ˈɪzənt ˈɹitʃəbəl | ðə ˈpleɪbʊk stɑps ˈɹʌnɪŋ kəmˈplitli
stress: IT’S the SAME with ANSIBLE | IF ONE HOST ISN'T REACHABLE | the PLAYBOOK STOPS RUNNING COMPLETELY
linking:
"host isn't" → /hoʊst ˈɪzənt/ (t + i linking)
"stops running" → /stɑps ˈɹʌnɪŋ/ (s + r linking)

speaker: Elena
text: True. And if we don’t log errors in the build script, debugging later becomes a nightmare.
ipa: tɹu | ænd ɪf wi doʊnt lɔɡ ˈɛɹɚz ɪn ðə bɪld skɹɪpt | dɪˈbʌɡɪŋ ˈleɪtɚ bɪˈkʌmz ə ˈnaɪtmɛɹ
stress: TRUE | AND IF WE DON’T LOG ERRORS in the BUILD SCRIPT | DEBUGGING LATER BECOMES a NIGHTMARE
linking:
"log errors" → /lɔɡ ˈɛɹɚz/ (g + e linking)
"debugging later" → /dɪˈbʌɡɪŋ ˈleɪtɚ/ (ŋ + l linking)

speaker: Marco
text: Right. It’s basically like muscle memory now — if something breaks, we check the logs first.
ipa: ɹaɪt | ɪts ˈbeɪsɪkli laɪk ˈmʌsəl ˈmɛmɚi naʊ — ɪf ˈsʌmθɪŋ bɹeɪks | wi tʃɛk ðə lɔɡz fɝst
stress: RIGHT | IT’S BASICALLY like MUSCLE MEMORY NOW — IF SOMETHING BREAKS | WE CHECK the LOGS FIRST
linking:
"something breaks" → /ˈsʌmθɪŋ bɹeɪks/ (ŋ + b linking)
"logs first" → /lɔɡz fɝst/ (z + f linking)

speaker: Elena
text: And if the logs aren’t clean, you end up wasting time chasing ghosts.
ipa: ænd ɪf ðə lɔɡz ˈɑɹənt klin | ju ɛnd ʌp ˈweɪstɪŋ taɪm ˈtʃeɪsɪŋ ɡoʊsts
stress: AND IF the LOGS AREN’T CLEAN | YOU END UP WASTING TIME CHASING GHOSTS
linking:
"logs aren’t" → /lɔɡz ˈɑɹənt/ (z + a linking)
"wasting time" → /ˈweɪstɪŋ taɪm/ (ŋ + t linking)

speaker: Marco
text: Exactly. And if a developer pushes directly to main, we get a Slack alert immediately.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ænd ɪf ə dɪˈvɛləpɚ ˈpʊʃɪz dəˈɹɛktli tu meɪn | wi ɡɛt ə slæk əˈlɝt ɪˈmiːdiətli
stress: EXACTLY | AND IF a DEVELOPER PUSHES DIRECTLY to MAIN | WE GET a SLACK ALERT IMMEDIATELY
linking:
"pushes directly" → /ˈpʊʃɪz dəˈɹɛktli/ (z + d linking)
"Slack alert" → /slæk əˈlɝt/ (k + a linking)

speaker: Elena
text: Haha, and if that happens more than once, we revoke their push access. No mercy.
ipa: hɑ hɑ | ænd ɪf ðæt ˈhæpənz mɔɹ ðæn wʌns | wi ɹɪˈvoʊk ðɛɹ pʊʃ ˈæksɛs | noʊ ˈmɝsi
stress: HAHA | AND IF THAT HAPPENS MORE THAN ONCE | WE REVOKE THEIR PUSH ACCESS | NO MERCY
linking:
"happens more" → /ˈhæpənz mɔɹ/ (z + m linking)
"push access" → /pʊʃ ˈæksɛs/ (sh + a linking)
